vision.notes: Eagle rays are active swimmers in the open ocean, suggesting good vision for navigation and prey detection. Mobula tarapacana basking near the surface indicates a reliance on vision.

mechanoreception.notes: Cartilaginous fishes possess a lateral line system for detecting water movement and pressure changes, crucial for detecting prey and avoiding predators in their aquatic environment. Also inner ear provides awareness of orientation, gravity, and acceleration, which are important for locomotion.

electroreception.notes: Cartilaginous fishes possess ampullae of Lorenzini, enabling them to detect weak electric fields produced by other organisms, aiding in prey detection.

chemoreception.notes: Used for detecting chemical cues in the water, potentially important for locating prey (mollusks and crustaceans) and navigating their environment.
